intro: Calyptranthes lucida, commonly known as the shining calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with dark green, leathery leaves that are arranged in opposite pairs. Its flowers, which are usually white or pale pink, bloom in clusters and are often visited by birds and insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
